MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

affiliate.description: True if this account is an affiliate

first_month_discount_percentage.description: Discount percentage for the first month of a subscription

seconds_left.description: Approximately seconds the credits will last with current usage. Returns null if no servers are on

subscription_pay_with_credits.description: If true, try to pay subscription with credits first

time_left.description: Human readable approximate of the time the credits will last with current usage, for seconds see seconds_left

trial.description: An account is considered trial when no payments has been made

added_voice_server.description: ID of a voice server that was purchased with this server

autostop.description: Automatically stop server when empty <autostop_minutes> min

autostop_minutes.description: Minutes until autostop triggers if is is enabled

booting.description: Is the server in booting state?

confirmed.description: Has the server been ordered yet (used internally)

cost_per_hour.description: Current cost per hour for this server

custom_domain.description: Use a custom domain for the server

cycle_months_12_discount_percentage.description: Discount percentage for a yearly subscription

cycle_months_1_discount_percentage.description: Discount percentage for a monthly subscription

cycle_months_3_discount_percentage.description: Discount percentage for a quarterly subscription

default_file_locations.description: Physical location of the server addons (used internally)

disk_usage_bytes.description: Disk usage in bytes, only available in single GET

duplicate_source_server.description: ID of a server that this was cloned from, if any

enable_core_dump.description: Write core dump file on server crash

first_month_discount_percentage.description: Discount percentage for the first month of a subscription

game.description: A lowercase string identifying the game that this server is running

match_id.description: Ongoing match using our match API, if any

max_cost_per_hour.description: Max cost per hour for this server

max_cost_per_month.description: Max cost per month for this server

max_disk_usage_gb.description: Max disk usage excluding base installation in GB

month_credits.description: Credits this server has used this month

month_reset_at.description: UNIX timestamp when the month_credits will be reset

prefer_dedicated.description: Prefer assignment to dedicated hosts on account

private_ip.description: Private IP of game server (only available with Syntropy integration)

reboot_on_crash.description: Automatically reboot the server in case of server crash

server_error.description: Have we detected an error on the server?

server_image.description: Server image to use for this server

subscription_cycle_months.description: 0 if server is pay as you go, otherwise subscription cycle length in months

subscription_renewal_failed_attempts.description: Number of failed attempts to renew this subscription

teamfortress2_settings.description: (Team Fortress 2 only) Settings specific to teamfortress2

user_data.description: Custom metadata for the server,is not used by the DatHost system

duration.description: How long the player has been online (only CS:GO and TeamFortress 2)

gotv.description: (CS:GO only) Port used for gotv streaming

gotv_secondary.description: (CS:GO only) Port used for gotv streaming

query.description: (Valheim only) Port used for connecting to game

autoload_configs.description: List of configs to load automatically

enable_gotv_secondary.description:
Enables a secondary GOTV stream on the same server.
Warning: The tv_delay and tv_delay1 shouldn’t be more than 10 seconds apart, otherwise the server runs the risk of a sudden shutdown.

maps_source.description: Maps source - mapgroup, workshop or workshop_single_map (in single map mode only workshop_start_map_id is loaded)

sourcemod_admins.description: This string is written as is to csgo/addons/sourcemod/configs/admins_simple.ini, documentation can be found here: https://wiki.alliedmods.net/Adding_Admins_(SourceMod)

workshop_authkey.description: Workshop collection authkey, leave blank to use our default Authkey

workshop_start_map_id.description: Steam ID of workshop start map

sourcemod_admins.description: This string is written as is to tf/addons/sourcemod/configs/admins_simple.ini, documentation can be found here: https://wiki.alliedmods.net/Adding_Admins_(SourceMod)

ts_server_id.description: TeamSpeak server instance ID (useful for server query)

admins_steamid64.description: JSON list of server admins in SteamID64 format

post.summary: Send a line of text to the server console

post.description:
Please note that the server's files are duplicated from a local cache, to make sure the
latest file changes are preserved, update the local cache with the sync-files method
first.

Returns the new server.

parameters.description: An optional fields mask
parameters.name: X-Fields

404.description: A server with this id was not found

post.summary: Duplicate a server (copies settings and files to a new server)

parameters.description: If true, only files added by the user will be shown, default is all files
parameters.name: hide_default_files

parameters.description: If true, also return files that has been deleted by the user
parameters.name: include_deleted_files

parameters.description: Path to use as root, leave empty to get all files
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: If true, return filesizes with filenames
parameters.name: with_filesizes

404.description: A server with this id was not found

delete.description:
The path is counted from the root node as seen in the file manager in the control panel,
i.e. to delete csgo/cfg/server.cfg the path would be cfg/server.cfg.

404.description: A server with this id was not found

delete.summary: Delete a file/directory from the gameserver

get.description:
The path is counted from the root node as seen in the file manager in the control panel,
i.e. to retrieve csgo/cfg/server.cfg the path would be cfg/server.cfg

If the path is a directory you will receive a zip file with the directory's contents

Note that files are retrieved from an API cache which is synced periodically
(approximately once per minute) from the gameserver, to make sure all files
on the server is retrieveble, run /game-servers/{server_id}/sync-files first.

parameters.description: If true, files up to 100kB will be returned as text/plain and bigger files will return an error
parameters.name: as_text

404.description: A server with this id was not found, or file not found

get.summary: Download a file from the gameserver

post.description:
The path is counted from the root node as seen in the file manager in the control panel,
i.e. to write csgo/cfg/server.cfg the path would be cfg/server.cfg, if the path ends
with / a directory will be created and the file parameter will be ignored.

There is a upload limit of 100MB on dathost.net, use upload.dathost.net
(with the same path) to upload files up to 500MB.

parameters.description: The file to be uploaded as a multipart/form-data body (Python example), if not provided an empty file/directory will be created
parameters.name: file

404.description: A server with this id was not found

507.description: Your disk quota of 30GB per server (excluding base installation) has been exceeded

post.summary: Upload a file to the gameserver

put.description:
Moves path to destination, the paths are counted from the root node
as seen in the file manager in the control panel,
i.e. to delete csgo/cfg/server.cfg the path would be cfg/server.cfg.

parameters.description: Destination path
parameters.name: destination

404.description: A server with this id was not found

put.summary: Move a file/directory on the gameserver

parameters.description: An optional fields mask
parameters.name: X-Fields

and void any changes you have made. It's not possible to revert this change.

post.description: This will reboot the server if the server is already on.

parameters.name: allow_host_reassignment

404.description: A server with this id was not found

500.description: Failed to start server, if this issue persists, please contact support@dathost.net

post.description:
This manually triggers a sync between the gameserver and the local cache which is used
for duplicating servers.
This is done automatically approximately once per five minutes.

404.description: A server with this id was not found

507.description: Your disk quota of 30GB per server (excluding base installation) has been exceeded

post.summary: Unzip a file on the GameServer

post.description: Please note that the Match API is free up to 100 matches / month, after that you will be charged in accordance to our pricing here.

parameters.description: An optional fields mask
parameters.name: X-Fields

parameters.description: Time until match is canceled if not everyone has joined
parameters.name: connect_time

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !pause in-game chat command. It uses the same configuration as Valves built-in feature, control it with the cvars mp_team_timeout_time and mp_team_timeout_max.
parameters.name: enable_pause

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable PlayWin cheat detection for this match.
parameters.name: enable_playwin

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !ready in-game chat command.
parameters.name: enable_ready

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !tech in-game chat command. It will pause the match until one player of each team has written !unpause
parameters.name: enable_tech_pause

parameters.description: Id of the game server to run the match on. Must be a CS:GO server on the same account as the match
parameters.name: game_server_id

parameters.description: Map 1
parameters.name: map1

parameters.description: Team that starts on the CT side on map 1
parameters.name: map1_start_ct

parameters.description: Map 2
parameters.name: map2

parameters.description: Team that starts on the CT side on map 2
parameters.name: map2_start_ct

parameters.description: Map 3
parameters.name: map3

parameters.description: Team that starts on the CT side on map 3
parameters.name: map3_start_ct

parameters.description: Map 4
parameters.name: map4

parameters.description: Team that starts on the CT side on map 4
parameters.name: map4_start_ct

parameters.description: Map 5
parameters.name: map5

parameters.description: Team that starts on the CT side on map 5
parameters.name: map5_start_ct

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to when the match is done. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: match_end_webhook_url

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to when the match series is done. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match-series GET endpoint
parameters.name: match_series_end_webhook_url

parameters.description: Prefix of in game chat messages from the match bot
parameters.name: message_prefix

parameters.description: Number of maps to play in the maps series
parameters.name: number_of_maps

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to when the PlayWin match analysis is done. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: playwin_result_webhook_url

parameters.description: If enable_ready is true, the game will wait until this number of players in each team have written !ready
parameters.name: ready_min_players

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to after each round. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: round_end_webhook_url

parameters.description:
Comma separated list of Steam-IDs of spectators, if any.
Example: STEAM_1:1:18592381,STEAM_1:1:23918572
Please note that Steam Ids in CS:GO starts with STEAM_1, if you have a Steam Id starting with STEAM_0 you should use the same id but change the beginning to STEAM_1, for more info see https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID#SteamID_Uses
parameters.name: spectator_steam_ids

parameters.description: Steam-ID of an optional coach in team 1
parameters.name: team1_coach_steam_id

parameters.description: Flag of team 1 (ISO alpha-2: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)
parameters.name: team1_flag

parameters.description: Name of team 1
parameters.name: team1_name

parameters.description:
Comma separated list of Steam-IDs in team 1.
Example: STEAM_1:1:28497369,STEAM_1:1:39283721,STEAM_1:1:19283721
Please note that Steam Ids in CS:GO starts with STEAM_1, if you have a Steam Id starting with STEAM_0 you should use the same id but change the beginning to STEAM_1, for more info see https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID#SteamID_Uses
parameters.name: team1_steam_ids

parameters.description: Steam-ID of an optional coach in team 2
parameters.name: team2_coach_steam_id

parameters.description: Flag of team 2 (ISO alpha-2: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)
parameters.name: team2_flag

parameters.description: Name of team 2
parameters.name: team2_name

parameters.description:
Comma separated list of Steam-IDs in team 2.
Example: STEAM_1:1:29382341,STEAM_1:1:42314538,STEAM_1:1:14923842
Please note that Steam Ids in CS:GO starts with STEAM_1, if you have a Steam Id starting with STEAM_0 you should use the same id but change the beginning to STEAM_1, for more info see https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID#SteamID_Uses
parameters.name: team2_steam_ids

parameters.description: Set to "false" to start the game when all players has connected even if there are missing coaches
parameters.name: wait_for_coaches

parameters.description: Wait for GOTV delay to catch up before changing to next map
parameters.name: wait_for_gotv_before_nextmap

parameters.description: Set to "false" to start the game when all players has connected even if there are missing spectators
parameters.name: wait_for_spectators

parameters.description: Warmup time after everyone have joined
parameters.name: warmup_time

parameters.description: If set, this value will be set as an Authorization HTTP header on all webhook requests.
parameters.name: webhook_authorization_header

post.summary: Start a match series (best of 2, best of 3, best of 5)

parameters.description: An optional fields mask
parameters.name: X-Fields

404.description: A match series with this id was not found

get.summary: Get all info about one match series

post.description: Please note that the Match API is free up to 100 matches / month, after that you will be charged in accordance to our pricing here.

parameters.description: An optional fields mask
parameters.name: X-Fields

parameters.description: Time until match is canceled if not everyone has joined
parameters.name: connect_time

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable this knife round plugin: https://github.com/dathost/CSGO-Knife-Round
parameters.name: enable_knife_round

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !pause in-game chat command. It uses the same configuration as Valves built-in feature, control it with the cvars mp_team_timeout_time and mp_team_timeout_max.
parameters.name: enable_pause

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable PlayWin cheat detection for this match.
parameters.name: enable_playwin

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !ready in-game chat command.
parameters.name: enable_ready

parameters.description: Set to "true" to enable the !tech in-game chat command. It will pause the match until one player of each team has written !unpause
parameters.name: enable_tech_pause

parameters.description: Id of the game server to run the match on. Must be a CS:GO server on the same account as the match
parameters.name: game_server_id

parameters.description: Map (if this is empty the start map configured on the game server will be used)
parameters.name: map

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to when the match is done. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: match_end_webhook_url

parameters.description: Prefix of in game chat messages from the match bot
parameters.name: message_prefix

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to when the PlayWin match analysis is done. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: playwin_result_webhook_url

parameters.description: If enable_ready is true, the game will wait until this number of players in each team have written !ready
parameters.name: ready_min_players

parameters.description: URL to send a webhook to after each round. It is sent as a HTTP POST with the same JSON format as the match GET endpoint
parameters.name: round_end_webhook_url

parameters.description:
Comma separated list of Steam-IDs of spectators, if any.
Example: STEAM_1:1:18592381,STEAM_1:1:23918572
Please note that Steam Ids in CS:GO starts with STEAM_1, if you have a Steam Id starting with STEAM_0 you should use the same id but change the beginning to STEAM_1, for more info see https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID#SteamID_Uses

parameters.name: team1_flag

parameters.description: Name of team 1
parameters.name: team1_name

parameters.description:
Comma separated list of Steam-IDs in team 1 which starts as Terrorists.
Example: STEAM_1:1:28497369,STEAM_1:1:39283721,STEAM_1:1:19283721
Please note that Steam Ids in CS:GO starts with STEAM_1, if you have a Steam Id starting with STEAM_0 you should use the same id but change the beginning to STEAM_1, for more info see https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/SteamID#SteamID_Uses
